results.title: The Beehive
results.credit_line:
Zanny Begg

Digital video, stereo sound, variable duration

Artbank + ACMI Commission, ACMI Collection
results.material_description: Single channel digital video and software, colour and audio
results.brief_description: The Beehive explores the unsolved murder of Sydney anti-development campaigner Juanita Nielsen. The inaugural Artbank + ACMI Commission, the video installation examines themes of gentrification, corruption, sex-work, feminism and non-conformist lifestyles.

constellations_other.name: Neo-noir
constellations_other.description: Blade Runner's retro-futurist setting lends it a timeless quality, while also connecting it to the past and the future.

constellations_other.name: Women and crime
constellations_other.description: The allure and fascination of dangerous women and women in danger.

results.description:
Zanny Begg’s The Beehive is the inaugural Artbank + ACMI Commission supporting ambitious and experimental screen-based work at the nexus of film and art.

The Beehive is a non-linear experimental documentary exploring the unsolved murder of Sydney anti-development campaigner and glamourous style icon Juanita Nielsen in Kings Cross in 1975. Juanita’s body has never been found and her murderers have never been charged.

The Beehive consists of scripted fictions, documentary interviews and choreographed scenes with multiple actors playing the role of Juanita. The film is ever-changing, as a different combination of footage is randomly selected for each screening with 1,344 possible variations. The Beehive therefore continually morphs and evolves to reveal different interpretations of this violent historical act and its social context. Operating like a forensic investigation, the film presents a variety of puzzle pieces, asking new questions and potentially pointing to an answer.

The title is a reference to Juanita Nielsen’s famous hairdo but is also a metaphor for human cities. In classical times the beehive was seen as a hierarchical and densely industrious hub; in pre-Christian symbolism the beehive was a dark cooperative womb guided by a powerful queen. This clash between utilitarian and feminist interpretations of our cities provides a poetic tension that flows through the film.

Who killed Juanita Nielsen?
description_for_label: The Beehive explores the unsolved murder of Sydney anti-development campaigner Juanita Nielsen. The inaugural Artbank + ACMI Commission, the video installation examines themes of gentrification, corruption, sex-work, feminism and non-conformist lifestyles.
results.credit_line_for_label:
Zanny Begg

Digital video, stereo sound, variable duration

Artbank + ACMI Commission, ACMI Collection

results.title: Collide
results.brief_description:
Collide is an interactive artwork comprising 9 images. It was born from a wish to make the viewing of the images a kind of journey- where the movement of the eye and the cursor make a path, mouse clicks causing progression along that path.

Using the metaphor of journey making the artist found a way to allow a progression from image to image by way of using a hotspot

results.title: Hunter Schafer went on live to expose Silq
results.brief_description: Trans actress and model Hunter Schafer went live on Instagram to expose Silq, a nightclub in Düsseldorf, for refusing her assistant entry because she is trans. Schafer connected with up to 30.1K of her followers in real time to call out the club as “not safe for transgender people”. @schaferfiles, a Twitter fan account for the actress, ensured that Schafer’s broadcast could be accessed beyond the live stream, screen recording and reposting the video to Twitter. The viral nature of Schafer’s video demonstrates the power of social media as a tool for activism.
results.title_for_label: Hunter Schafer went on live to expose Silq
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Trans actor and model Hunter Schafer went live on Instagram to expose Silq, a nightclub in Düsseldorf, for refusing her assistant entry because she is trans. Schafer connected with up to 30.1K of her followers in real time to call out the club as “not safe for transgender people”. @schaferfiles, a Twitter fan account for the actress, ensured that Schafer’s broadcast could be accessed beyond the live stream, screen recording and reposting the video to Twitter. The viral nature of Schafer’s video demonstrates the power of social media as a tool for activism.

Schafer connected with up to 30.1K of her followers in real time to call out the club. @schaferfiles, a Twitter fan account, ensured that Schafer’s broadcast could be accessed beyond the live stream, screen recording and reposting the video to Twitter. results.title: What the Water Gave Me

constellations_other.name: From gallery to screen (placeholder)
constellations_other.description: Explore how famous films, videogames and music videos have taken their cue from the art of the past.

results.description: The music video for ‘What the Water Gave Me’ intersperses footage of Florence + the Machine’s studio recording sessions with kaleidoscope shots of Welch performing the song, evoking the crashing of waves and reflective quality of water.
description_for_label: The music video for ‘What the Water Gave Me’ intersperses footage of Florence + the Machine’s studio recording sessions with kaleidoscope shots of Welch performing the song, evoking the crashing of waves and reflective quality of water.

results.title: Frida
results.creator_credit: Miramax Films, Ventanarosa Productions, Sarah Green, Salma Hayek, Joy Polstein, Lizz Speed, Nancy Hardin, Lindsay Flickinger, Roberto Sneider and Julie Taymor
results.brief_description: Academy Award winning biographical feature about Mexican artist Frida Kahlo. The story unfolds in splendid colour from Frida’s early years, as we watch Frida’s journey to become a recognised artist in her own right.

constellations_other.name: From gallery to screen (placeholder)
constellations_other.description: Explore how famous films, videogames and music videos have taken their cue from the art of the past.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Miramax Films, Ventanarosa Productions, Sarah Green, Salma Hayek, Joy Polstein, Lizz Speed, Nancy Hardin, Lindsay Flickinger, Roberto Sneider and Julie Taymor
results.description: Academy Award winning biographical feature about Mexican artist Frida Kahlo, played by Salma Hayek. The story unfolds in splendid colour from Frida’s early years and follows through to the moment of her death. We witness her struggles in life against traditional society’s perceptions of women, her own physical disabilities and most importantly, her struggle to become a recognised artist/painter in her own right. Cast includs Alfred Molina as Diego Rivera, Antonio Banderas, Valeria Golino, Ashley Judd, Mia Maestro, Edward Norton and Geoffrey Rush. Second disc contains many special features.
description_for_label: Academy Award winning biographical feature about Mexican artist Frida Kahlo, played by Salma Hayek. The story unfolds in splendid colour from Frida’s early years and follows through to the moment of her death. We witness her struggles in life against traditional society’s perceptions of women, her own physical disabilities and most importantly, her struggle to become a recognised artist/painter in her own right. Cast includs Alfred Molina as Diego Rivera, Antonio Banderas, Valeria Golino, Ashley Judd, Mia Maestro, Edward Norton and Geoffrey Rush. Second disc contains many special features.

results.title: Britain's First Light
results.brief_description:
‘First Light’ is a British wide organisation that uses film and media production to develop skills in young people aged up to 25.
Talented youth from a wide range of backgrounds are provided with training led by film and media industry professionals using industry standard equipment. This collection draws works from several years of this creative partnership.

results.title: Until My Heart's, Like, Finished
results.creator_credit: Peter Snelling, Phil Shepherd, Martin Hodgson, Somerset Film and First Light
results.brief_description: On the day of your 16th birthday, your mum kicks you out of home for good. You live in a car. You sofa surf. You sleep rough. Life for these young people has been tough with many challenges. Here they tell their stories in their own words, reveal they have learnt about how to survive and make plans for putting their lives back together.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Snelling, Phil Shepherd, Martin Hodgson, Somerset Film and First Light

results.title: The Race
results.creator_credit: Nikki Rose, Kinetoscope Productions and First Light
results.brief_description: Neil and David met at nursery school. There was something different about Neil but David liked him, even though he often got himself into a bad temper. Neil knew that because of his condition eventually they would part company but David vowed that they would always remain best friends.

results.title: Prehistoric Pet Shop
results.creator_credit: Chris Barnard, Mathew Buck, George Ing, Create Studios, Dacoit Studios, Evil Twin Artworks and First Light
results.brief_description: Prehistoric Pet Shop is about a caveman whose alarm clock stops working. But not just any alarm clock - the clock was a bird with an unfortunate heart problem. The caveman goes to the pet shop to complain about his faulty alarm clock. A homage to Monty Python’s parrot sketch, this hilarious short reveals that complaining can get you more than just a new alarm clock.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Barnard, Mathew Buck, George Ing, Create Studios, Dacoit Studios, Evil Twin Artworks and First Light

results.title: Pirates of the Indian Ocean
results.creator_credit: Omni Rahman, Enamul Khan, Rafi Rahman, Northamptonshire Bangladeshi Association, Wind & Foster Media and First Light
results.brief_description: Clumsy but lovable DJ duo Mankind and Small-Steps have built a devoted following to their pirate radio show. Raging against the machine in their own inimitable style, will they reach the top of radio programming or be caught on the wrong side of the law before they reach their dream?
